name: expropriation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of taking away money or property, especially for public use without payment to the owner, or for personal use illegally: The need for expropriations could delay construction by up to nine months. Villagers are protesting the expropriation of their lands to build a new international airport. See
expropriate
More examplesFewer examplesThe commission expressed grave concern over the expropriation of land and the demolition of houses.The actions appear to be expropriation.The government can use its powers of expropriation, if necessary, to get the land needed for the second phase of the project.
